qmsStandards.qmsModification:
"SUBPART O: STATISTICAL TECHNIQUES 
§ 820.250 Statistical techniques. 820.250 is addressed by following: 
 a)       Each QMS Process document has a metrics section which describes the set of metrics used to identify the process capability and control. Compliance Reports are run at a regular cadence to identify the process deviations within each project.
 Also, the Global Operations team runs a set of weekly reports to understand product characteristics and trends. 
 b)      Data analysis is done on the complete set of data as opposed to sampled data. Therefore sampling plans are not documented and are not applicable to NextGen.
 During product build lifecycle various performance indicators are produced by the software development teams. These indicators, based on the QMS defined build methodology, are used by management to monitor the performance and risk exposure of the product development teams. The reports generated using these data include all projects' scope, schedule, quality and overall status indicators. The process team performs trend analysis and uses process run charts to better understand overall process status and to help predict future performance and improvement needs."

"SUBPART K: Labeling and Packaging Control 
§ 820.120 - Device labeling.  820.120 is addressed by following:
 NextGen's Configuration Management Tool (e.g., Perforce and Team Foundation Server), keeps the version history and assigns unique versions (i.e., label) to the software builds which helps in avoiding mix-ups during receipt and installation of our product. NextGen's Configuration Management Process defines the activities on how software is version controlled and revisions are managed.  
§ 820.130 - Device packaging. 820.130 relates to the packaging and shipping containers; therefore  820.130 is Not Applicable for software development organization"

"SUBPART N: SERVICING 
§ 820.200 Servicing 820.200 is addressed by following: 
 a)       At NextGen, the client services or support is provided per the Support Processes.  Per the support process, each client incident is maintained and managed using client support systems.
 The maintenance of our software is also performed per out Patch process.
 b)      The Global Operations team runs the weekly reports to analyze customer incidents and notify NextGen management.
 c)       Any issue which that has potential to cause harm to the patient, or issue which has potential to result in negative impact on customer business functions, or issue which has potential to disclose patient health information are considered to be high risk issues.  All high risk client reported issues are handled and managed using Critical Issue Management Process. Each high risk issue are researched and clients are made aware about the issue via Newsflash (email notification).
 d)      The details and updates on the client reported issues and services are maintained in Customer Relationship Management tool (i.e., Success Community aka Salesforce) with date & time of service; product & version # of product that is being serviced; and details on when and how the issue will be fixed and delivered."

"SUBPART M: RECORDS 
§ 820.180 General Requirements 820.180 is addressed by following:
 All records or deliverables related to QMS processes are stored in controlled documented repository per Document Control Process.
 The QMS Document Control process defines the standards, formats, storage (including retention policy) and management procedures for QMS procedures, process and supporting documents
§ 820.181 Device Master Record 820.181 is addressed by following:
 (a) The Device Master Records are maintained in QMS shared controlled document repository and NextGen’s Lifecycle Management System and supporting repositories, e.g. SharePoint, Perforce. 
 (b), (c), (d) Our QMS defines the following comprehensive processes that are maintained, stored or linked from QMS website. All QMS process and procedure documents follows the Document Control Process for document preparation and approval:
 ·         Software Design Process, defines the process for designing, reviewing, approving the functional design specification and technical design specifications.
 ·         Verification and Validation Process, defines planning activities, and quality assurance procedures for product testing.
 ·         Configuration Management Process,  defines our processes for building ,  packaging and versioning our software builds and/ or releases
 ·         Software Development Lifecycle Process, defines software development activities and procedure during our product build and maintenance
 ·         Installation Process ,  defines the installation process and procedure of our software on customer environment
 ·         Support Process,  defines the client support procedures for client issues or complaints
§ 820.184 Device History Record 820.184 is addressed by the following:
 The Design History Records are maintained in NextGen's Lifecycle management system and supporting repositories, e.g. SharePoint, Perforce produced during the product build lifecycle. These software tools and underlying database contains a history of each product feature and the corresponding system/software requirements, design specifications and testing results.
§ 820.186 Quality System Record 820.186 is addressed by the following:
 All Quality Management deliverables including process, procedures, work instructions , project artifacts etc., are maintained in the QMS shared document repository and are controlled using the Document Control Process
§ 820.198 Complaint files 820.198 is addressed by the following: 
 (a), (b) All customer complaints (aka issues), and feedback are handled by the Client Support organization, per Support Processes. All complaints and history of complaints are maintained and stored in client support system (e.g.,   Salesforce). Our Support Process defines the activities to be performed during issue receipt, review, evaluation, investigation and resolution.
 (c), (d) Any issue which has potential to cause harm to the patient, or issue which has potential to result in negative impact on customer business functions, or issue which has potential to disclose patient health information are considered to be high risk issues , aka P-Critical.  All P-Critical client reported issues are handled and managed using Critical Issue Management Process. Each high risk issue is researched and clients are made aware about the issue via Newsflash Process (email notification). The Newsflash includes the issue description, i.e., version of product where the issue was encountered,  product versions the issue affects; date when newsflash was released to clients; other products this issue might impact; acceptable workaround on how to perform action without encountering the same issue; and the information on where and when the issue will be fixed.
 Also, during the submission of high risk issues or Meaningful Use issues, clients are asked to fill detailed information within the form to analyze, evaluate the issue with quick turnaround. The form is designed per Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ) standard"

"SUBPART H 
§ 820.80 - Receiving, in-process, and finished device acceptance.  820.80 is addressed by the following QMS Standards
 a)       NextGen's Verification and Validation process defines the activities to test, verify and validate the requirements.
 b)      All requirements are inspected and tested per Verification and Validation process and the evidence for the testing activities are stored in Test Case Management Tool Any defects encountered during the testing of the product are logged in Defect Management Tool per the Defects Management Procedure
 c)       At NextGen every product release undergoes at least 4 types of testing at various stages of the software development lifecycle, i.e., Functional Testing, Regression Testing, System Testing and UAT testing (by physicians or other SMEs and Beta Customers). Every test case defines the expected results per the defined requirements and during the test runs, testers verify that the test case meets the expected results. Per the Requirements Management Process and procedure, requirements must only be promoted to next stage if QA deems that the requirements is working as expected. Requirements are flagged completed once QA has successfully completed functional testing on those requirements. Once functional testing is completed, requirements are moved to next stage for further system testing and UAT testing. Record of each testing activities are maintained and reports are generated to satisfy product release criteria.
 d)      At NextGen, there are defined product release criteria that states the acceptance criteria to release the product for distribution to the client base. Before the product is released or is ready for distribution, these release criteria are reviewed and approved by the stakeholder at the Gate meeting. Gate review and approval records are maintained and is considered as release authorization. Any deviation from release criteria are also reviewed and are approved by the stakeholders."

"SUBPART J: Corrective and preventive action. 
   § 820.100 - Corrective and preventive action. 820.100 is addressed by the following QMS Standards: 
 a)       Corrective and Preventive Actions are identified and managed using NextGen's Root Cause Analysis Process and Corrective and Preventive Action (CAPA) Process.
 The Root Cause Analysis Process defines the criteria and method for analyzing and identifying a root cause of any recurring defects, critical defects, regression defects, and process issues etc. RCAs are identified using 5Whys methodology. The recommendations and findings from the RCAs are maintained and are proposed for potential CAPA initiative.  These CAPA initiatives are presented to management for their approval and assignment of responsibility. Once a CAPA is initiated and/ or implemented, reports are generated to measure and analyze the effectiveness of CAPA. At NextGen, CAPAs and any related documents (including reports) are maintained in the CAPA management system (i.e., SharePoint)"

"FDA 21CFR820 Regulation-Reference NextGen QMS Process & Standards Mapping

SUBPART A 
§ 820.1, § 820.3, § 820.5 These paragraphs are addressed by the following NextGen Standards:
 820.1: NextGen Quality Management System Scope defines the scope of QMS at NextGen Healthcare
 820.3: Definition of terms, NextGen Quality Management System (QMS) defines standard terminology and contains a Glossary
 820.5: Reference to QMS, addressed by NextGen's QMS system"

"SUBPART G: Production and Process Controls 
§ 820.70 Production and process controls 820.70 is addressed by the following QMS Standards:
 A) NextGen's QMS systems defines the product lifecycle and includes various mechanisms for monitoring and controlling the core lifecycle processes to ensure that the product is being designed and built according to specifications. This begins in the Concept phase where product management experts, physicians and executive management define, review and approve new product ideas. Our Product Development Lifecycle Process defines how features are defined and controlled and management review and approval to proceed is obtained. Further refinement of the specification occurs next in Requirement Management activity. Multi-functional engineering, program management, QA/test, physicians, user experience and user documentation teams review the requirements produced by the business analysts. These quality management peer reviews use quality checklists and knowledge of the approved feature baseline in order to determine that the intended functionality is being properly defined and will be reflected in the end product. Similar techniques are used during subsequent design and construct phases. Finally the Verification & Validation activity is driven by the requirements' baseline and traces the evolution of features - to- requirements - to - design and then into specific test cases. This independent verification step ensures product readiness for the Beta and eventual General release of the product.
 1.             Defined processes, procedures and other job aids are available throughout this lifecycle, including Requirements Management, Requirements Review & Approval, Software Architecture & Design, Program & Project Management, QA/Test, User-Centered Design and final User Documentation.
 2.             The program/project managers monitor various aspects of the design/construct activity and testing run by the QA teams to monitor progress, quality & scope on the evolving products. The project team status reports, QA progress, and peer review results are gathered and used to determine how well the product production is progressing and to assess whether intervention is required.
 3.             Compliance reports and requirement completion statuses are used to monitor process compliance.
 4.             Processes & process support materials are defined and controlled within NextGen's QMS only after multi-functional review & approval.
 5.             Product and project artifact and specification templates, examples and quality standards are defined and maintained with NextGen's QMS.
 b.             NextGen's Change Control Process establishes the approach for controlling changes to the product baseline features, requirements and timeline and is used throughout the production lifecycle.
 c.              Environmental issues are mostly not applicable to our software lifecycle; however architectural designs and constraints are produced to support verification of the system requirements for the end product.
 d.             Personnel: this paragraph is not applicable to NextGen.
 e.             Contamination Control: also n/a
 f.               Buildings: NextGen uses professional offices with typical Information Technology (IT) labs and test environments.
 1)   &  2) NextGen’s IT labs and personal computing devices undergo regular hardware & software maintenance, upgrades & includes inspections.
          3) Adjustments: n/a
 h.             Manufacturing Material: n/a
 i.               Automated processes: The Lifecycle Management system used for much of the production lifecycle is periodically tested/verified for correct operations. Software upgrade are installed & checked out using a pre-defined quality checklist in a test environment prior to release approval and issuance into full production. The QA/test team uses the same lifecycle management system mentioned previously. In addition to that the QA/Test team utilizes a software tool, integrated with the lifecycle management system, to automate the functional testing of NextGen products. This tool is also maintained in a similar manner as the lifecycle management system; upgrades are planned and test in an off-line manner so as to not interfere or risk the on-going production activity. Detailed test checklists are used to ensure proper functionality prior to release approval and issuance.  
§ 820.72 Inspection, measuring, and test equipment 820.72 is Not Applicable to NextGen, all NextGen products, the product features and requirements are verified by testing or inspection. The validation methods defined in this section does not apply to NextGen.
§ 820.75 Process validation 820.75 is Not Applicable to NextGen as calibration of test and measurement equipment does not exist in our software development environment."

"SUBPART L: Handling, Storage, Distribution, and Installation 
§ 820.140 Handling 820.180 is addressed by following:
 NextGen's Configuration Management Tool (e.g., Perforce and Team Foundation Server), keeps the version history and assigns unique versions to the software builds which helps in avoiding mix-ups during receipt and installation of our product. NextGen's Configuration Management Process defines the activities on how software product is version controlled and revisions are managed/controlled.  
§ 820.150 Storage. 820.150 explains the controls during storage areas and stock rooms for product to prevent mix-ups, damage, deterioration, contamination; therefore 820.150 is Not Applicable for software development organizations.
§ 820.160 Distribution. At NextGen, our software products are distributed depending on the platform (i.e., desktop based application or web based). Our desktop based applications are distributed by uploading the General Release (GR) build of the product on the File Transfer Protocol (FTP) site and/ or installed by NextGen's implementation team. The web based applications (e.g., HQM, Patient Portal) are deployed on the server instances and are distributed to clients. 
 The FTP site is controlled and maintained per the Build Distribution Procedure by Beta managers at NextGen.
 GR build is packaged software which is tested and passed all quality control checks before it's uploaded for client use. The builds are developed, tested and packaged per Software Development Lifecycle process.
 Clients can download the latest version of our product from the FTP site and our NextGen Management Agent (NMA) keeps the track of number of downloads, version downloaded and name of client download the version.
§ 820.170 Installation 820.170 is addressed by following: 
 NextGen installation team performs product installation by using Installation quick guides, aka installation instruction templates specific to the product. Every installation instruction template has pre-requisites, set of actions to install and confirmation activities once the installation is completed. Completed installation instructions are stored in client relationship management tool (e.g., Salesforce). "

"SUBPART D: Document Controls 
§ 820.40 Document controls. 820.40 is addressed by the following QMS Standards:
 NextGen's QMS system defines the company standards for creating, updating, reviewing and approving a document. This Document Control process is applicable to all NextGen employees. The process ensures that document are properly formatted, written, reviewed, stored and accessible by those who require access.
SUBPART E: Purchasing controls. 
§ 820.50 Purchasing controls. 820.50 is addressed by the following QMS Standards: 
 NextGen utilizes a standard Procurement Process that:
 A. Defines the process for Vendor evaluation & setup in the procurement system.
 ·     This includes evaluating the vendors based on the business justification and their ability to successfully execute the contract.
 ·     Standard contract language and internal management reviews based on Purchase Order/contract size define management oversight and control on procured services & products.
 ·     A master vendor list is maintained. The Procurement process defines how this list is managed and used throughout the procurement process, including periodic maintenance & updates.
SUBPART F: Identification and Traceability 
   § 820.60 - Identification.  820.60 is addressed by the following QMS Standards: 
 NextGen's Configuration Management process and the Source Code Management procedure defines how the product is identified and controlled throughout the build lifecycle. After delivery to customers NextGen's installation and support organizations utilize a similar configuration management processes, the Golden Database Maintenance Procedure is used to manage & identify the various products in use by NextGen customers. Distribution logs are maintained to support periodic customer support, trouble-shooting and upgrade activity.
   § 820.65 - Traceability. 820.65 is Not Applicable to NextGen. None of our software products are implantable or used in implantable devices, nor are they used in a life-sustainment role."

"SUBPART I: Nonconforming product. 
§ 820.90 - Nonconforming product. 820.90 is addressed by the following QMS Standards
 a)       NextGen's Verification and Validation process defines the activities to test, verify and validate the requirements.
 b)      All requirements are inspected and tested per Verification and Validation process and the evidence for the testing activities are stored in Test Case Management Tool Any defects encountered during the testing of the product are logged in Defect Management Tool per the Defects Management Procedure
 c)       At NextGen every product release undergoes at least 4 types of testing at various stages of the software development lifecycle, i.e., Functional Testing, Regression Testing, System Testing and UAT testing (by physicians or other SMEs and Beta Customers). Every test case defines the expected results per the defined requirements and during the test runs, testers verify that the test case meets the expected results. Per the Requirements Management Process and procedure, requirements must only be promoted to the next stage if the QA team deems that the requirements are working as expected. Requirements are flagged/completed once QA has successfully completed functional testing on those requirements. Once functional testing is completed, requirements are moved to next stage for further system testing and UAT testing. Record of each testing activities are maintained and reports are generated to satisfy product release criteria.
 d)      At NextGen, there are defined product release criteria that states the acceptance criteria to release the product for distribution to the client base. Before the product is released or is ready for distribution, these release criteria are reviewed and approved by the stakeholder at the Gate meeting. Gate review and approval record templates are defined to support documentation is captured/maintained for this release authorization. Any deviation from release criteria are also reviewed, defined for capture in the template after approval by the stakeholders."

allowedTestFunctionalities.description:
Ambulatory: 170.315(e)(1)(i)(B)(2)(i) All of the following data:
(1) The Common Clinical Data Set (which should be in their English (i.e., non-coded) representation if they associate with a vocabulary/code set).
(2) Ambulatory setting only. Provider's name and office contact information.
(4) Laboratory test report(s). Laboratory test report(s), including:
(i) The information for a test report as specified all the data specified in 42 CFR 493.1291(c)(1) through (7);
(ii)The information related to reference intervals or normal values as specified in 42 CFR 493.1291(d); and
(iii)The information for corrected reports as specified in 42 CFR 493.1291(k)(2).
(5) Diagnostic image report(s)

(5) Diagnostic image report(s)

cqmResults.title: Depression Remission at Twelve Months
cqmResults.description: Patients age 18 and older with major depression or dysthymia and an initial Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-9) score greater than nine who demonstrate remission at twelve months (+/- 30 days after an index visit) defined as a PHQ-9 score less than 5. This measure applies to both patients with newly diagnosed and existing depression whose current PHQ-9 score indicates a need for treatment

criterion.title: Clinical Quality Measures - Record and Export
Clinical Quality Measures - Import and Calculate

cqmResults.title: Adult Major Depressive Disorder (MDD): Suicide Risk Assessment
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older with a diagnosis of major depressive disorder (MDD) with a suicide risk assessment completed during the visit in which a new diagnosis or recurrent episode was identified

criterion.title: Clinical Quality Measures - Record and Export
Clinical Quality Measures - Import and Calculate

cqmResults.title: Heart Failure (HF): Beta-Blocker Therapy for Left Ventricular Systolic Dysfunction (LVSD)
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older with a diagnosis of heart failure (HF) with a current or prior left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) < 40% who were prescribed beta-blocker therapy either within a 12 month period when seen in the outpatient setting OR at each hospital discharge

criterion.title: Clinical Quality Measures - Record and Export
Clinical Quality Measures - Import and Calculate

cqmResults.title: HIV Screening
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients 15-65 years of age who have been tested for HIV within that age range

cqmResults.title: Preventive Care and Screening: Screening for High Blood Pressure and Follow-Up Documented
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older seen during the reporting period who were screened for high blood pressure AND a recommended follow-up plan is documented based on the current blood pressure (BP) reading as indicated

criterion.title: Clinical Quality Measures - Record and Export
Clinical Quality Measures - Import and Calculate

cqmResults.title: Use of High-Risk Medications in the Elderly
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients 66 years of age and older who were ordered high-risk medications. Two rates are reported.  Percentage of patients who were ordered at least one high-risk medication.  Percentage of patients who were ordered at least two different high-risk medications.

cqmResults.title: Cataracts: Complications within 30 Days Following Cataract Surgery Requiring Additional Surgical Procedures
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older with a diagnosis of uncomplicated cataract who had cataract surgery and had any of a specified list of surgical procedures in the 30 days following cataract surgery which would indicate the occurrence of any of the following major complications: retained nuclear fragments, endophthalmitis, dislocated or wrong power IOL, retinal detachment, or wound dehiscence

criterion.title: Clinical Quality Measures - Record and Export

cqmResults.title: Heart Failure (HF): Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme (ACE) Inhibitor or Angiotensin Receptor Blocker (ARB) Therapy for Left Ventricular Systolic Dysfunction (LVSD)
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older with a diagnosis of heart failure (HF) with a current or prior left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) < 40% who were prescribed ACE inhibitor or ARB therapy either within a 12 month period when seen in the outpatient setting OR at each hospital discharge

criterion.title: Clinical Quality Measures - Record and Export
Clinical Quality Measures - Import and Calculate

cqmResults.title: Appropriate Treatment for Children with Upper Respiratory Infection (URI)
cqmResults.description: Percentage of children 3 months-18 years of age who were diagnosed with upper respiratory infection (URI) and were not dispensed an antibiotic prescription on or three days after the episode

cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older with primary total knee arthroplasty (TKA) who completed baseline and follow-up patient-reported functional status assessments.

cqmResults.title: Falls: Screening for Future Fall Risk

cqmResults.title: Bone density evaluation for patients with prostate cancer and receiving androgen deprivation therapy
cqmResults.description: Patients determined as having prostate cancer who are currently starting or undergoing androgen deprivation therapy (ADT), for an anticipated period of 12 months or greater and who receive an initial bone density evaluation. The bone density evaluation must be prior to the start of ADT or within 3 months of the start of ADT.

cqmResults.title: Cataracts: 20/40 or Better Visual Acuity within 90 Days Following Cataract Surgery
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older with a diagnosis of uncomplicated cataract who had cataract surgery and no significant ocular conditions impacting the visual outcome of surgery and had bestcorrected visual acuity of 20/40 or better (distance or near) achieved within 90 days following the cataract surgery.

cqmResults.title: Weight Assessment and Counseling for Nutrition and Physical Activity for Children and Adolescents
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients 3-17 years of age who had an outpatient visit with a Primary Care Physician (PCP) or Obstetrician/Gynecologist (OB/GYN) and who had evidence of the following during the measurement period. Three rates are reported.  Percentage of patients with height, weight, and body mass index (BMI) percentile documentation  Percentage of patients with counseling for nutrition  Percentage of patients with counseling for physical activity

criterion.title: Clinical Quality Measures - Record and Export
Clinical Quality Measures - Import and Calculate

cqmResults.title: Cervical Cancer Screening
cqmResults.description: Percentage of women 21-64 years of age who were screened for cervical cancer using either of the following criteria: Women age 21-64 who had cervical cytology performed every 3 years  Women age 30-64 who had cervical cytology/human papillomavirus (HPV) cotesting performed every 5 years.

criterion.title: Clinical Quality Measures - Record and Export
Clinical Quality Measures - Import and Calculate

cqmResults.title: Coronary Artery Disease (CAD): Beta-Blocker Therapy-Prior Myocardial Infarction (MI) or Left Ventricular Systolic Dysfunction (LVEF <40%)
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older with a diagnosis of coronary artery disease seen within a 12 month period who also have a prior MI or a current or prior LVEF <40% who were prescribed beta-blocker therapy

cqmResults.title: Anti-depressant Medication Management
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients 18 years of age and older who were treated with antidepressant medication, had a diagnosis of major depression, and who remained on an antidepressant medication treatment. Two rates are reported.  Percentage of patients who remained on an antidepressant medication for at least 84 days (12 weeks).  Percentage of patients who remained on an antidepressant medication for at least 180 days (6 months).

Clinical Quality Measures - Import and Calculate

cqmResults.title: Controlling High Blood Pressure
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients 18-85 years of age who had a diagnosis of hypertension and whose blood pressure was adequately controlled (<140/90mmHg) during the measurement period.

cqmResults.title: Depression Utilization of the PHQ-9 Tool
cqmResults.description: Patients age 18 and older with the diagnosis of major depression or dysthymia who have a Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-9) tool administered at least once during a 4-month period in which there was a qualifying visit

cqmResults.title: Bipolar Disorder and Major Depression: Appraisal for alcohol or chemical substance use

cqmResults.title: Childhood Immunization Status
cqmResults.description: Percentage of children 2 years of age who had four diphtheria, tetanus and acellular pertussis (DTaP); three polio (IPV), one measles, mumps and rubella (MMR); three H influenza type B (HiB); three hepatitis B (Hep B); one chicken pox (VZV); four pneumococcal conjugate (PCV); one hepatitis A (Hep A); two or three rotavirus (RV); and two influenza (flu) vaccines by their second birthday.

cqmResults.title: Dementia: Cognitive Assessment
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients, regardless of age, with a diagnosis of dementia for whom an assessment of cognition is performed and the results reviewed at least once within a 12  month period

cqmResults.title: Use of Imaging Studies for Low Back Pain
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients 18-50 years of age with a diagnosis of low back pain who did not have an imaging study (plain X-ray, MRI, CT scan) within 28 days of the diagnosis.

cqmResults.title: Preventive Care and Screening: Screening for Depression and Follow-Up Plan
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 12 years and older screened for depression on the date of the encounter using an age appropriate standardized depression screening tool AND if positive, a follow-up plan is documented on the date of the positive screen.

cqmResults.title: Documentation of Current Medications in the Medical Record
cqmResults.description: Percentage of visits for patients aged 18 years and older for which the eligible professional attests to documenting a list of current medications using all immediate resources available on the date of the encounter. This list must include ALL known prescriptions, over-the-counters, herbals, and vitamin/mineral/dietary (nutritional) supplements AND  must contain the medications' name, dosage, frequency and route of administration.

cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older with a diagnosis of diabetic retinopathy who had a dilated macular or fundus exam performed with documented communication to the physician who manages the ongoing care of the patient with diabetes mellitus regarding the findings of the macular or fundus exam at least once within 12 months

cqmResults.title: Ischemic Vascular Disease (IVD): Use of Aspirin or Another Antiplatelet
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients 18 years of age and older who were diagnosed with acute myocardial infarction (AMI), coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) or percutaneous coronary interventions (PCI) in the 12 months prior to the measurement period, or who had an active diagnosis of ischemic vascular disease (IVD) during the measurement period, and who had documentation of use of aspirin or another antiplatelet during the measurement period.

cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 6 months and older seen for a visit between October 1 and March 31 who received an influenza immunization OR who reported previous receipt of an influenza immunization

cqmResults.description: The percentage of patients 18-75 years of age with diabetes (type 1 and type 2) who received a foot exam (visual inspection and sensory exam with mono filament and a pulse exam) during the measurement year.

Percentage of patients who initiated treatment within 14 days of the diagnosis.  Percentage of patients who initiated treatment and who had two or more additional services with an AOD diagnosis within 30 days of the initiation visit.

cqmResults.description: Percentage of the following patients - all considered at high risk of cardiovascular events - who were prescribed or were on statin therapy during the measurement period: Adults aged >= 21 years who were previously diagnosed with or currently have an active diagnosis of clinical atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD); OR Adults aged >= 21 years who have ever had a fasting or direct low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) level >= 190 mg/dL or were previously diagnosed with or currently have an active diagnosis of familial or pure hypercholesterolemia; OR Adults aged 40-75 years with a diagnosis of diabetes with a fasting or direct LDL-C level of 70-189 mg/dL

cqmResults.title: Prostate Cancer: Avoidance of Overuse of Bone Scan for Staging Low Risk Prostate Cancer Patients
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients, regardless of age, with a diagnosis of prostate cancer at low (or very low) risk of recurrence receiving interstitial prostate brachytherapy, OR external beam radiotherapy to the prostate, OR radical prostatectomy, OR cryotherapy who did not have a bone scan performed at any time since diagnosis of prostate cancer

cqmResults.title: Closing the Referral Loop: Receipt of Specialist Report
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients with referrals, regardless of age, for which the referring provider receives a report from the provider to whom the patient was referred.

Clinical Quality Measures - Import and Calculate

cqmResults.title: ADHD: Follow-Up Care for Children Prescribed Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) Medication
cqmResults.description: Percentage of children 6-12 years of age and newly dispensed a medication for attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) who had appropriate follow-up care. Two rates are reported.  Percentage of children who had one follow-up visit with a practitioner with prescribing authority during the 30-Day Initiation Phase.  Percentage of children who remained on ADHD medication for at least 210 days and who, in addition to the visit in the Initiation Phase, had at least two additional follow-up visits with a practitioner within 270 days (9 months) after the Initiation Phase ended.

criterion.title: Clinical Quality Measures - Record and Export
Clinical Quality Measures - Import and Calculate

cqmResults.title: HIV/AIDS: Pneumocystis Jiroveci Pneumonia (PCP) Prophylaxis
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 6 weeks and older with a diagnosis of HIV/AIDS who were prescribed Pneumocystis jiroveci pneumonia (PCP) prophylaxis

criterion.title: Clinical Quality Measures - Record and Export
Clinical Quality Measures - Import and Calculate

cqmResults.title: Home Management Plan of Care (HMPC) Document Given to Patient/Caregiver
cqmResults.description: An assessment that there is documentation in the medical record that a Home Management Plan of Care (HMPC) document was given to the pediatric asthma patient/caregiver.

cqmResults.title: Assessed for Rehabilitation
cqmResults.description: Ischemic or hemorrhagic stroke patients who were assessed for rehabilitation services.

cqmResults.title: Use of Appropriate Medications for Asthma
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients 5- 64 years of age who were identified as having persistent asthma and were appropriately prescribed medication during the measurement period.

cqmResults.title: Hemoglobin A1c Test for Pediatric Patients
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients 5-17 years of age with diabetes with an HbA1c test during the measurement period

cqmResults.title: Breast Cancer: Hormonal Therapy for Stage IC-IIIC Estrogen Receptor/ Progesterone Receptor (ER/PR) Positive Breast Cancer
cqmResults.description: Percentage of female patients aged 18 years and older with Stage IC through IIIC, ER or PR positive breast cancer who were prescribed tamoxifen or aromatase inhibitor (AI) during the 12-month reporting period

cqmResults.title: Diabetes: Low Density Lipoprotein (LDL) Management
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients 18-75 years of age with diabetes whose LDL-C was adequately controlled (<100 mg/dL) during the measurement period.

cqmResults.title: HIV/AIDS: Medical Visit
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients, regardless of age, with a diagnosis of HIV/AIDS with at least two medical visits during the measurement year with a minimum of 90 days between each visit

cqmResults.title: ADE Prevention and Monitoring: Warfarin Time in Therapeutic Range
cqmResults.description: Average percentage of time in which patients aged 18 and older with atrial fibrillation who are on chronic warfarin therapy have International Normalized Ratio (INR) test results within the therapeutic range (i.e., TTR) during the measurement period.

cqmResults.title: HIV/AIDS: RNA control for Patients with HIV
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 13 years and older with a diagnosis of HIV/AIDS, with at least two visits during the measurement year, with at least 90 days between each visit, whose most recent HIV RNA level is <200 copies/mL.

cqmResults.title: Ischemic Vascular Disease (IVD): Complete Lipid Panel and LDL Control
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients 18 years of age and older who were discharged alive for acute myocardial infarction (AMI), coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) or percutaneous coronary interventions (PCI) in the 12 months prior to the measurement period, or who had an active diagnosis of ischemic vascular disease (IVD) during the measurement period, and who had a complete lipid profile performed during the measurement period and whose LDL-C was adequately controlled (< 100 mg/dL).

cqmResults.title: Hearing Screening Prior To Hospital Discharge
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the proportion of births that have been screened for hearing loss before hospital discharge.

cqmResults.title: Aspirin Prescribed at Discharge
cqmResults.description: Acute myocardial infarction (AMI) patients who are prescribed aspirin at hospital discharge

cqmResults.title: Primary PCI Received Within 90 Minutes of Hospital Arrival
cqmResults.description: Acute myocardial infarction (AMI) patients with ST-segment elevation on the ECG closest to arrival time receiving primary PCI during the hospital stay with a time from hospital arrival to PCI of 90 minutes or less.

cqmResults.title: Fibrinolytic Therapy Received Within 30 Minutes of Hospital Arrival
cqmResults.description: Acute myocardial infarction (AMI) patients with ST-segment elevation on the ECG closest to arrival time receiving fibrinolytic therapy during the hospital stay and having a time from hospital arrival to fibrinolysis of 30 minutes or less.

cqmResults.title: Venous Thromboembolism Prophylaxis
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the number of patients who received VTE prophylaxis or have documentation why no VTE prophylaxis was given the day of or the day after hospital admission or surgery end date for surgeries that start the day of or the day after hospital admission.

cqmResults.title: Discharged on Antithrombotic Therapy
cqmResults.description: Ischemic stroke patients prescribed antithrombotic therapy at hospital discharge

cqmResults.title: Intensive Care Unit Venous Thromboembolism Prophylaxis
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the number of patients who received VTE prophylaxis or have documentation why no VTE prophylaxis was given the day of or the day after the initial admission (or transfer) to the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) or surgery end date for surgeries that start the day of or the day after ICU admission (or transfer).

cqmResults.title: Discharged on Statin Medication
cqmResults.description: Ischemic stroke patients who are prescribed statin medication at hospital discharge.

cqmResults.title: Venous Thromboembolism Patients with Anticoagulation Overlap Therapy
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the number of patients diagnosed with confirmed VTE who received an overlap of parenteral (intravenous [IV] or subcutaneous [subcu]) anticoagulation and warfarin therapy. For patients who received less than five days of overlap therapy, they should be discharged on both medications or have a reason for discontinuation of overlap therapy. Overlap therapy should be administered for at least five days with an international normalized ratio (INR) greater than or equal to 2 prior to discontinuation of the parenteral anticoagulation therapy, discharged on both medications or have a reason for discontinuation of overlap therapy

cqmResults.title: Antithrombotic Therapy By End of Hospital Day 2
cqmResults.description: Ischemic stroke patients administered antithrombotic therapy by the end of hospital day 2.

cqmResults.title: Elective Delivery
cqmResults.description: Patients with elective vaginal deliveries or elective cesarean births at >= 37 and < 39 weeks of gestation completed

cqmResults.title: Exclusive Breast Milk Feeding
cqmResults.description: Exclusive breast milk feeding during the newborn's entire hospitalization.

cqmResults.title: Median Time from ED Arrival to ED Departure for Admitted ED Patients
cqmResults.description: Median time from emergency department admission to time of discharge from the emergency room for patients admitted to the facility from the emergency department.

cqmResults.title: Median Admit Decision Time to ED Departure Time for Admitted Patients
cqmResults.description: Median time (in minutes) from admit decision time to time of discharge from the emergency department for emergency department patients admitted to inpatient status.

cqmResults.title: Healthy Term Newborn
cqmResults.description: Percent of term singleton live births (excluding those with diagnoses originating in the fetal period) who DO NOT have significant complications during b

cqmResults.title: Stroke Education
cqmResults.description: Ischemic or hemorrhagic stroke patients or their caregivers who were given educational materials during the hospital stay addressing all of the following: activation of emergency medical system, need for follow-up after discharge, medications prescribed at discharge, risk factors for stroke, and warning signs and symptoms of stroke.

cqmResults.title: Venous Thromboembolism Patients Receiving Unfractionated Heparin with Dosages/Platelet Count Monitoring by Protocol or Nomogram
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the number of patients diagnosed with confirmed VTE who received intravenous (IV) UFH therapy dosages AND had their platelet counts monitored using defined parameters such as a nomogram or protocol.

cqmResults.title: Venous Thromboembolism Discharge Instructions
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the number of patients diagnosed with confirmed VTE that are discharged to home, home care, court/law enforcement or home on hospice care on warfarin with written discharge instructions that address all four criteria: compliance issues, dietary advice, follow-up monitoring, and information about the potential for adverse drug reactions/ interactions.

cqmResults.title: Colon Cancer: Chemotherapy for AJCC Stage III Colon Cancer Patients
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 18 through 80 years with AJCC Stage III colon cancer who are referred for adjuvant chemotherapy, prescribed adjuvant chemotherapy, or have previously received adjuvant chemotherapy within the 12-month reporting period.

cqmResults.title: Anticoagulation Therapy for Atrial Fibrillation/Flutter
cqmResults.description: Ischemic stroke patients with atrial fibrillation/ flutter who are prescribed anticoagulation therapy at hospital discharge.

cqmResults.title: Preventive Care and Screening: Cholesterol - Fasting Low Density Lipoprotein (LDL-C) Test Performed
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 20 through 79 years whose risk factors have been assessed and a fasting LDLC test has been performed.

cqmResults.title: Preventive Care and Screening: Risk-Stratified Cholesterol -Fasting Low Density Lipoprotein (LDLC)
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 20 through 79 years who had a fasting LDL-C test performed and whose riskstratified fasting LDL-C is at or below the recommended LDL-C goal.

cqmResults.title: Initial Antibiotic Selection for Community-Acquired Pneumonia (CAP) in Immunocompetent Patients
cqmResults.description: (PN-6) Immunocompetent patients with CommunityAcquired Pneumonia who receive an initial antibiotic regimen during the first 24 hours that is consistent with current guidelines (Population 1) Immunocompetent ICU patients with CommunityAcquired Pneumonia who receive an initial antibiotic regimen during the first 24 hours that is consistent with current guidelines (Population 2) Immunocompetent nonIntensive Care Unit (ICU) patients with CommunityAcquired Pneumonia who receive an initial antibiotic regimen during the first 24 hours that is consistent with current guidelines

cqmResults.title: Thrombolytic Therapy
cqmResults.description: Acute ischemic stroke patients who arrive at this hospital within 2 hours of time last known well and for whom t-PA was initiated at this hospital within 3 hours of time last known well.

cqmResults.title: Urinary catheter removed on Postoperative Day 1 (POD 1) or Postoperative Day 2 (POD 2) with day of surgery being day zero
cqmResults.description: Surgical patients with urinary catheter removed on Postoperative Day 1 or Postoperative Day 2 with day of surgery being day zero.

cqmResults.title: Median Time from ED Arrival to ED Departure for Discharged ED Patients
cqmResults.description: Median elapsed time from emergency department arrival to emergency room departure for patients discharged from the emergency department.

cqmResults.title: Prophylactic Antibiotic Received Within One Hour Prior to Surgical Incision
cqmResults.description: Surgical patients with prophylactic antibiotics initiated within one hour prior to surgical incision. Patients who received vancomycin or a fluoroquinolone for prophylactic antibiotics should have the antibiotics initiated within two hours prior to surgical incision. Due to the longer infusion time required for vancomycin or a fluoroquinolone, it is acceptable to start these antibiotics within two hours prior to incision time.

cqmResults.title: Prophylactic Antibiotic Selection for Surgical Patients
cqmResults.description: Surgical patients who received prophylactic antibiotics consistent with current guidelines (specific to each type of surgical procedure).

cqmResults.title: Statin Prescribed at Discharge
cqmResults.description: Acute myocardial infarction (AMI) patients who are prescribed a statin medication at hospital discharge.

cqmResults.title: Incidence of Potentially-Preventable Venous Thromboembolism
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the number of patients diagnosed with confirmed VTE during hospitalization (not present at admission) who did not receive VTE prophylaxis between hospital admission and the day before the VTE diagnostic testing order date.

cqmResults.title: Appropriate Use of DXA Scans in Women Under 65 Years Who Do Not Meet the Risk Factor Profile for Osteoporotic Fracture
cqmResults.description: Percentage of female patients 50 to 64 years of age without select risk factors for osteoporotic fracture who received an order for a dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA) scan during the measurement period.

cqmResults.title: International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) or American Urological Association-Symptom Index (AUA-SI) Change 6-12 Months After Diagnosis of Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients with an office visit within the measurement period and with a new diagnosis of clinically significant Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia who have International Prostate Symptoms Score (IPSS) or American Urological Association (AUA) Symptom Index (SI) documented at time of diagnosis and again 6-12 months later with an improvement of 3 points

cqmResults.title: Safe Use of Opioids- Concurrent Prescribing
cqmResults.description: Proportion of inpatient hospitalizations for patients 18 years of age and older prescribed, or continued on, two or more opioids or an opioid and benxodiazepine concurrently at discharge

cqmResults.title: Core Clinical Data Elements for the Hybrid Hospital-Wide Readmission (HWR) Measure with Claims and Electronic Health Record Data
cqmResults.description: This logic is intended to extract electronic clinical data. This is not an electronic clinical quality measure and this logic will not produce measure results. Instead, it will produce a file containing the data that CMS will link with administrative claims to risk adjust the Hybrid HWR outcome measure. It is designed to extract the first resulted set of vital signs and basic laboratory results obtained from encounters for adult Medicare Fee-For-Service patients admitted to acute care short stay hospitals.

cqmResults.title: Intravesical Bacillus-Calmette-Guerin for non-muscle invasive bladder cancer
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients initially diagnosed with non-muscle invasive bladder cancer and who received intravesical Bacillus-Calmette-Guerin (BCG) within 6 months of bladder cancer staging.

cqmResults.title: Core Clinical Data Elements for the Hybrid Hospital-Wide (All-Condition, All-Procedure) Risk-Standardized Mortality Measure (HWM)
cqmResults.description: This logic is intended to extract electronic clinical data. This is not an electronic clinical quality measure and this logic will not produce measure results. Instead, it will produce a file containing the data that CMS will link with administrative claims to risk adjust the Hybrid HWM outcome measure. It is designed to extract the first resulted set of vital signs and basic laboratory results obtained from encounters for adult Medicare Fee-For-Service patients admitted to acute care short stay hospitals.
